groups.name: Content
groups.description: Requirements related to the substantive content of the articles.

requirements.description: An article should start with a clear definition in the lead section.
requirements.reference: The first sentence of the lead should define what the scope of the article is.

requirements.description: The lead section should summarize the most important points of the article.
requirements.reference: The lead should summarize the most important points of the article.

requirements.description: The article should include a section on gene function.
requirements.reference: Articles should include a section on the function of the gene.

requirements.description: Include a section on the gene's role in disease if applicable.
requirements.reference: If the gene is associated with a disease, include a section on this.
requirements.when: Applicable if the gene is associated with a disease.

requirements.description: Provide information on gene expression patterns.
requirements.reference: Include information on where and when the gene is expressed.

groups.name: Formatting
groups.description: Requirements related to the formatting of the articles.

requirements.description: Use the infobox template for gene articles.
requirements.reference: Gene articles should use the {{Infobox gene}} template.

requirements.description: Use the infobox template for protein articles.
requirements.reference: Protein articles should use the {{Infobox protein}} template.

requirements.description: Ensure consistent use of headings and subheadings.
requirements.reference: Use consistent headings and subheadings to organize content.

groups.name: Language Usage
groups.description: Guidelines for the appropriate use of language, including gene nomenclature and abbreviations.

requirements.description: Human gene names should be written in all capitals.
requirements.reference: Human gene names are written in capitals, for example ALDOA, INS, etc.
Gene symbols should be italicized, for example, BRCA1.

requirements.description: Protein names should not be italicized.
requirements.reference: Protein names are not italicized, for example, BRCA1 protein.

groups.name: Citations
groups.description: Requirements related to the citation of sources within the articles.

requirements.description: Cite reliable sources for all statements.
requirements.reference: All statements should be supported by reliable sources.

requirements.description: Use inline citations for specific claims.
requirements.reference: Use inline citations to support specific claims.

groups.name: Structure
groups.description: Requirements related to the structural organization of the articles.

requirements.description: Follow a standard structure for gene articles.
requirements.reference: Gene articles should follow a standard structure: lead, infobox, function, clinical significance, etc.

requirements.description: Include a section on gene nomenclature.
requirements.reference: Include a section on the nomenclature of the gene.
